body: @atantry1, it looks like no detections were stored. Have you run `deeplabcut.evaluate_network` first?

@jeylau Thanks for responding to my question!

I ran evaluate_network first and got the labeled images in the evaluation-results folder, but I also received a wxAssertion error and the labeled images didn't have the bodyparts legend. Could this be why no detections were stored? If so, how can I solve or bypass this error?

Note: I have about 1318 images in my training set, so maybe the evaluate_network function didn't complete its task?

Input code: 
`deeplabcut.evaluate_network(path_config_file, plotting=True)`

Output:
```

wxAssertionError: C++ assertion "Assert failure" failed at ..\..\src\msw\toolbar.cpp(938) in wxToolBar::Realize(): Could not add bitmap to toolbar
```

Errr yes, that is a wxpython issue also reported here #835. I haven't figured out yet a clean way to work around it. My best advice for now is [this one](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/835#issuecomment-668727719); that should let you move on 😊!

Thanks for the workaround, I now have the detections!

However, I encountered more problems when I tried to use the create_video_with_all_detections function. 

Input:
```
video_path=[r'C:\Users\winshah\Desktop\sniff+mate_trial2-Adarsh Tantry-2020-08-21\videos\wt2-1_mating.mp4']
deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections(path_config_file,video_path,DLCscorername='DLC_resnet50_sniff+mate_trial2Aug21shuffle1_50000-snapshot-50000')
```

Output:

Also, when I tried to trim and crop some novel videos in the video editor tab of the GUI, I ended up with the following output, but no trimmed video (see screenshot).

Output:
```
Slicing and saving to name C:\Users\winshah\Desktop\adarsh_training_videos\20190117-152531_WT-4short.avi
Please, select your coordinates (draw from top left to bottom right ...)
Cropping and saving to name C:\Users\winshah\Desktop\adarsh_training_videos\wt-4shortcropped.mp4
```

Screenshot:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70354938/91919373-98168780-ec7a-11ea-82f7-b80e84ca0a9e.png)

@atantry1 this is likely a permissions issue. Can you be sure you right-cilick and open the terminal "as an admin" before you run the GUI. Can you create the full.mp4 video from the GUI? Your videos/project has spaces and special characters, which might be also causing and issue.
